alert.note: Alert for Kent (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 01 at 5:26PM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Michigan, including the following county, Kent. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 525 PM EDT, Radar and automated rain gauges indicate between 1 and 2 inches of rain in the last hour, with another one inch of rain possible over the next hour. This is the same area that had several inches of rain and flooding two days ago. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Grand Rapids, Walker, Rockford, Sparta, Cedar Springs, Sand Lake, Wells Airport, Belmont, Northview, Cannonsburg, Paul C Miller-Sparta Airport and Comstock Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
